greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of nonnegative integers: a(n) = A263273(2*n) / 2.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9841
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
A000035(a(n)) = A000035(n). [This permutation preserves the parity of n.]
A264974(n) = a(2n)/2. [Thus the restriction onto even numbers induces yet another permutation.]
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{g, h}, g[x_] := x/3^IntegerExponent[x, 3]; h[x_] := x/g@ x; If[n == 0, 0, FromDigits[Reverse@ IntegerDigits[#, 3], 3] &@ g[n] h[n]]]; Table[f[2 n]/2, {n, 0, 81}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 04 2016,after _Jean-François Alcover_ at A263273 *)
program: def a030102(n): return 0 if n==0 else int(''.join(map(str, digits(n, 3)[1:][::-1])), 3)
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i==3 else i**f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return a263273(2*n)/2 # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 23 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2015
